color.description:
main color of the button: pattern: `#rgb`/`#rrggbb`/`#rrrgggbbb`/`rgb(r, g, b)`/`rgba(r, g, b, a)`.
For additional notes, please refer to: https://gtk-rs.org/gtk4-rs/stable/latest/docs/src/gdk4/rgba.rs.html#205
Default `#7B98FF`

extra_trigger_size.description:
transparent extra trigger area, must > 0 or else the button will not be triggered.
Default 5

event_map.description:
array of tuples(int, string), int refers for the mouse button id.
 if you don't know what id your extra mouse button is, please run with `way-edges [group_name] --mouse-debug`: example [[1, "kitty #open up kitty console"],]

groups.description:
Groups of buttons. you can activate each group by `way-edges [group_name]`.
Default empty array

name.description:
Name of the group, can be empty if exist only one group.
Default empty string

widgets.description:
Button items: available params:
edge | position | layer | width | height | margin | monitor_id | monitor_name | widget

edge.description:
edge of the screen: top/bottom/left/right.
Default `left`

position.description:
position of the edge: top/bottom; left/right; or leave empty string for center.
Default `center`

layer.description:
layer of the screen: background/bottom/top/overlay.
Default `top`

width.description:
width of the button. Can be either a number or a percentage.
Example: 15

height.description:
height of the button. Can be either a number or a percentage.
Example: "25%"

margin.description:
margin of the button, relative to the `position`.
Default all 0.

top.description:
top margin of the button
Default 0

bottom.description:
bottom margin of the button
Default 0

left.description:
left margin of the button
Default 0

right.description:
right margin of the button
Default 0

monitor_id.description:
Which monitor to show the button, ignored when given `monitor_name`.
Default 0

monitor_name.description:
Which monitor to show the button.
Default empty string
